paragraphs.content: Chapter 29
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 29

paragraphs.content: He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.

paragraphs.content: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.

paragraphs.content: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.

paragraphs.content: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.

paragraphs.content: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.

paragraphs.content: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

paragraphs.content: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.

paragraphs.content: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.

paragraphs.content: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.

paragraphs.content: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.

paragraphs.content: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.

paragraphs.content: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.

paragraphs.content: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the LORD lighteneth both their eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the Lord lighteneth both their eyes.

paragraphs.content: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

paragraphs.content: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.

paragraphs.content: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.

paragraphs.content: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.

paragraphs.content: Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.

paragraphs.content: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.

paragraphs.content: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

paragraphs.content: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.

paragraphs.content: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
paragraphs.contentHtml: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.

paragraphs.content: A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.

paragraphs.content: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.

paragraphs.content: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be safe.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord shall be safe.

paragraphs.content: Many seek the ruler’s favour; but every man’s judgment cometh from the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Many seek the ruler’s favour; but every man’s judgment cometh from the Lord.

paragraphs.content: An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.
